actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Voice Vote.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that May 8, 1985, the 40th anniversary of Victory in Europe (VE) Day, should be a day of tribute to those who served and sacrificed to bring the war in Europe to a successful conclusion.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress and the American people that May 8, 1985, VE Day, is a special day to pay tribute to those who brought the war in Europe to a successful conclusion, and to renew our commitment to freedom.

titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that May 8, 1985, the 40th anniversary of Victory in Europe (VE) Day, should be a day of tribute to those who served and sacrificed to bring the war in Europe to a successful conclusion.
